abstract: Shareholders voting at last week’s annual meeting registered a spike in dissatisfaction with Wal-Mart Stores compared to last year, according to the company’s vote tally.
snippet: Shareholders voting at last week’s annual meeting registered a spike in dissatisfaction with Wal-Mart Stores compared to last year, according to the company’s vote tally.
lead_paragraph: Investors last week expressed dissatisfaction with members of the board of Wal-Mart Stores at some of the highest levels ever disclosed by the company in electronic filings, according to a Monday filing by the company.

headline.main: Wal-Mart Vote Shows Rise in Shareholder Unrest
headline.print_headline: Wal-Mart Vote Shows Rise in Shareholder Unrest
